lead_paragraph: Abu Muhammad al-Adnani, who was behind the Islamic State’s call for attacks against Western interests around the world, died in Aleppo Province, the group said.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut; Maher Samaan from Paris; and Rukmini Callimachi from Naples, Italy.
byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and ANNE BARNARD

headline.print_headline: Key ISIS Officer Reported Dead in Syria’s North
headline.main: Senior ISIS Strategist and Spokesman Is Reported Killed in Syria

snippet: Abu Muhammad al-Adnani, who was behind the Islamic State’s call for attacks against Western interests around the world, died in Aleppo Province, the group said....
abstract: Islamic State reports death in Syria of Abu Muhammad al-Adnani, founding member, senior strategist and propagandist for group who was among world's most-wanted terrorists; Pentagon says American drone strike targeted Adnani but does not confirm death.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
